summary:
Michael is a Senior Talent Acquisition Partner at Syngenta, a global leader in seed and biologics development and production. He has over 25 years of experience in strategic talent acquisition and management, with a focus on research and development, operations, technology, engineering, and sales roles in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, biologics, bio-manufacturing, CDMO, antibody conjugate, cell and gene therapy, viral vectors, clinical research, process engineering and project management domains.

He is certified in IBM Agile Explorer, IBM Design Thinking Practitioner, and AgileTA Explorer, which enable him to apply agile and design thinking methodologies to his talent acquisition practices. He has a proven track record of globally engaging, guiding, and hiring thousands of highly valued and experienced senior research, technical, operations, management, sales, IT and other STEM professionals. His mission is to enable his clients and candidates to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

currentPositions.description:
My current recruitment focus covers R&D throughout all North America as well as other strategic areas across the Globe including throughout the UK, Netherlands and China.  

Syngenta Seeds is one of the world’s largest developers and producers of seed for farmers, commercial growers, retailers and small seed companies.

We’re a global innovation powerhouse with local, passionate, expert teams collaborating with farmers in every corner of the world to deliver solutions and create market opportunities. 

Our high-technology seeds help mitigate risks such as disease, insect, and climate pressures and allow farmers to meet the ever-growing demand for food and fuel, all while using fewer inputs and taking care of the land and our resources.

We have a team of 12,000 seed experts from research and seed development to production to logistics to sales and marketing, serving farmers in more than 100 countries

Our network of more than 150 R&D and Production sites collaborate with universities, incubators, scientists and production growers to invest $1.4B USD annually to bring next-generation innovations to the farm. This includes our partnerships with 51,000+ production growers across 26 countries to produce the demand for our seed.

Working in partnership with more than 400 universities, research institutes and commercial organizations, Seeds is constantly embracing collaboration and industry cooperation to tackle the agricultural challenges facing our planet. Innovations go beyond seed technology to include supporting digital tools and platforms that draw upon agronomic data to help farmers make more informed seed selection decisions, assess soil characteristics, and identify planting zones so they can better manage risk and maximize their investment.

Innovation, sustainability and growth – these are what the business strives for every day to ensure farmers have the best quality seeds to help feed the world.
www.syngenta.com/seeds
currentPositions.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Partner | R&D | North America - Seeds

headline: Senior Talent Acquisition Partner @ Syngenta | Global R&D Search Expert

message.text:
Syngenta Group is looking for: QC Manager - Seed Genetic Purity SQC for the Vegetables Production & Supply team in Nampa, Idaho. 
 
This role is responsible for managing all day-to-day seed testing operations and data review for the Vegetable Genetic Purity Quality Control (QC) Laboratories and ensuring that all testing is completed on-time to meet sales demand. Will lead and coach a team of dedicated employees in QC testing. Develop and optimize the people capability and asset base within the team in line with the QC strategy in close collaboration with Americas QC lead and other members of the QC leadership team. 

Position details/apply here:  https://lnkd.in/gPHpKdMY
#syngentacareers #qualitymanager #Seedquality #geneticpurity

Syngenta Group is looking for: Americas Operations Leader- Vegetables Seed Development in Woodland, CA, USA. 

We are seeking an experienced seasoned Station Manager and Leader to be based at our Woodland, California location. 

-->People leadership: # of direct reports 6-8 with overall responsibility for up to ~50 employees (depending on Crop / Region) (indirectly)
-->Geographic Scope: Region Americas stations: Woodland – Salinas – Naples - Culiacan

--Key responsibilities will be station management and to effectively lead the Vegetables Seeds Operations (including Nursery, Seeds Production and processing, Lab, Glasshouse, TI activities) organization to deliver on the Vegetable Seeds growth agenda.
--Develop staff and incorporate leading capabilities and technologies in daily operations to bring the highest quality products to market in an efficient and sustainable manner.
--Management of regional activities related to Seeds R&D Operations. This includes functional responsibility for infrastructure and capital improvements, Seeds Trialing and Operations and functional planning.

Position details/apply:  https://lnkd.in/gFdAYHtK

Syngenta Group is looking for: North America HSE Vegetable R&D lead in Nampa, Idaho. 

The overall purpose of the job is to act as primary HSE (Health, Safety, Environment) advisor / liaison for the North America Vegetables R&D organization, provide a single point of HSE coordination for Veg operations in the Americas, and provide support to the current Flowers Regional HSE Manager/HSE Business Partner in support of the Flowers R&D business.

In addition, role will partner with regional Vegetables P&S HSE colleagues and support Global Veg & Flowers business as HSE data analyst with accountability for coordinating key HSE messaging across Vegetables End to End from the 4 regions in support of Global Veg Leadership Team. Role may be based in Boise, ID or Woodland, CA.

Position details/apply link: https://lnkd.in/eZUkc_e6

Syngenta Group is looking for: Assistant Breeding Project Lead in Woodland, CALIFORNIA. 

We are currently seeking an Assistant Breeding Project Lead for the Germplasm Development team in Woodland California.  

The Assistant Breeding Project Lead (APL)/Assistant Breeder for melon will collaborate closely with the Lead Breeder to manage the melon breeding activities spanning from the initiation of breeding to advanced stage trialing. This role is pivotal in delivering a robust product pipeline for key market segments. The key responsibilities encompass nursery management, conducting hybrid trials, and providing high quality data to facilitate data-driven product advancement. Additionally, the individual will assist the Lead Breeder in integrating the latest tools and technologies into the breeding program.

Requires: MS or BS degree (3-5 years experience) in Genetics/Plant Breeding or related disciplines. MS candidates preferred.
->Good knowledge on experiment designs, data management and statistical analysis.
->Good understanding of R&D processes to identify the critical issues as well as engage with team members to solve problems.
->Sound knowledge of agronomy, physiology, pathology, plant nutrition and digital tools.
->Knowledge of automation and high throughput phenotyping tools is a plus.

Position details/apply link: https://lnkd.in/eSAavMjK

#plantbreeding  #seedsresearch
